articles.headline: ‘He Is a Child of War’: Giving Birth Amid Chaos in Ukraine
articles.snippet: As artillery shells fall, pregnant women are delivering prematurely, being shuttled in and out of bomb shelters or having babies in basements without even a midwife to help. Tens of thousands more are displaced.
articles.abstract: As artillery shells fall, pregnant women are delivering prematurely, being shuttled in and out of bomb shelters or having babies in basements without even a midwife to help. Tens of thousands more are displaced.
articles.lead_paragraph: KYIV, Ukraine — Before the war, Alina Shynkar’s gynecologist advised her to avoid stress during her pregnancy, suggesting she spend time “just watching cartoons and being silly.” It was simple enough advice, but not so easy to follow after air-raid sirens wailed, artillery booms rattled windows and vicious street fighting broke out a few miles away from her maternity hospital.

articles.headline: A Transformative Justice Whose Impact May Be Limited
articles.snippet: Judge Ketanji Brown Jackson will help make the Supreme Court look like the nation but will have little power to halt its rightward trajectory.
articles.abstract: Judge Ketanji Brown Jackson will help make the Supreme Court look like the nation but will have little power to halt its rightward trajectory.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — Judge Ketanji Brown Jackson, the first Black woman confirmed to the Supreme Court, will in one sense transform it. Once she replaces Justice Stephen G. Breyer, one of the 108 white men who preceded her, the court will look a lot more like the nation it serves.

articles.headline: Jackson Confirmed as First Black Woman to Sit on Supreme Court
articles.snippet: The vote was a bipartisan rejection of Republican attempts to paint her as a liberal extremist who had coddled criminals.
articles.abstract: The vote was a bipartisan rejection of Republican attempts to paint her as a liberal extremist who had coddled criminals.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — The Senate on Thursday confirmed Judge Ketanji Brown Jackson to the Supreme Court, making her the first Black woman to be elevated to the pinnacle of the judicial branch in what her supporters hailed as a needed step toward bringing new diversity and life experience to the court.
articles.byline: By Carl Hulse and Annie Karni

articles.headline: Bidding War for Spirit Could Undercut Power of Four Big Airlines
articles.snippet: The rival bids for Spirit from Frontier and JetBlue could create an airline that presents a more formidable challenge to American, Delta, Southwest and United.
articles.abstract: The rival bids for Spirit from Frontier and JetBlue could create an airline that presents a more formidable challenge to American, Delta, Southwest and United.
articles.lead_paragraph: When the dust settled on a big round of airline consolidation nearly a decade ago, four large companies came to dominate the industry. A new merger scramble could challenge that cozy arrangement.
articles.byline: By Niraj Chokshi and Lauren Hirsch

articles.headline: A Market Mystery: The ‘Wheat Whale’ That Came Out of Nowhere
articles.snippet: Who was behind the surge of trading in wheat futures last month? Some point to a group of Reddit users who mobbed an E.T.F. offering exposure to the wheat market.
articles.abstract: Who was behind the surge of trading in wheat futures last month? Some point to a group of Reddit users who mobbed an E.T.F. offering exposure to the wheat market.
articles.lead_paragraph: In early March, just days after Russia invaded Ukraine, a strange thing happened in the market for wheat futures: Trading came to an unexpected halt.

articles.headline: Hollywood Gets a New Giant
articles.snippet: The blockbuster merger of Discovery and WarnerMedia closed on Friday, putting many of the biggest names in movies, TV and news under one roof.
articles.abstract: The blockbuster merger of Discovery and WarnerMedia closed on Friday, putting many of the biggest names in movies, TV and news under one roof.
articles.lead_paragraph: Discovery, the medium-size media company that began as a small cable network in 1985, has completed something once unthinkable: assuming ownership of a fabled Hollywood company that controls Batman, Harry Potter, “Sex and the City,” “Game of Thrones,”  CNN and March Madness.

articles.headline: A 4-Year Degree Isn’t Quite the Job Requirement It Used to Be
articles.snippet: New research finds companies are starting to rely less on the college filter in hiring. But it remains an obstacle to opportunity for many.
articles.abstract: New research finds companies are starting to rely less on the college filter in hiring. But it remains an obstacle to opportunity for many.
articles.lead_paragraph: As a middle school student in New York, Shekinah Griffith saw a television news report of President Barack Obama visiting an innovative school in Brooklyn. Its program included high school, an associate degree in a technical subject, an internship and the promise of a good job.

articles.headline: Treasury Aims for Economic Pain on Russia, but Critics Question Effectiveness
articles.snippet: The Treasury Department’s deputy secretary, Wally Adeyemo, has been leading the effort to crack down on evasion and to coordinate with Europe.
articles.abstract: The Treasury Department’s deputy secretary, Wally Adeyemo, has been leading the effort to crack down on evasion and to coordinate with Europe.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — When Russia imposed retaliatory sanctions on top American officials last month, its government targeted President Biden and his top national security advisers, along with Wally Adeyemo, the deputy Treasury secretary, whose agency has been crafting the punitive measures aimed at crippling Russia’s economy.

articles.headline: Land Mines on a Timer, Scattered Over a Ukrainian Town
articles.snippet: Civilians near Kharkiv in northeastern Ukraine are discovering a new threat: munitions that eject up to two dozen small mines that explode at intervals.
articles.abstract: Civilians near Kharkiv in northeastern Ukraine are discovering a new threat: munitions that eject up to two dozen small mines that explode at intervals.
articles.lead_paragraph: BEZRUKY, Ukraine — When Sergiy, a 47-year-old construction worker, got out of bed Sunday morning in this small town in northeastern Ukraine, he discovered a chilling new hazard in a war filled with them: He had woken up in a minefield.
articles.byline: By Thomas Gibbons-Neff and John Ismay

articles.headline: Ex-Goldman Sachs Banker Convicted for His Role in a $4 Billion Fraud
articles.snippet: Roger Ng is most likely the only person who will face trial in the United States in connection with a scheme to loot billions from a Malaysian sovereign wealth fund.
articles.abstract: Roger Ng is most likely the only person who will face trial in the United States in connection with a scheme to loot billions from a Malaysian sovereign wealth fund.
articles.lead_paragraph: A former Goldman Sachs banker was convicted Friday on bribery and money-laundering charges stemming from a globe-spanning fraud scandal: the looting of more than $4 billion from a Malaysian sovereign wealth fund.
